text: Choosing the right perfume is a personal experience. We recommend considering factors such as your personality, preferred scent notes, and the occasion for which you'll be wearing the perfume.

On average, you can expect a perfume to last anywhere from 6 to 12 hours, but some fragrances may last even longer or shorter. To prolong the longevity of your perfume, apply it to pulse points and consider using matching scented body products or layering techniques.

Proper storage is essential for maintaining the quality and longevity of your perfumes. We recommend storing them in a cool, dark place away from direct sunlight and heat sources, such as bathroom cabinets or dressers. Exposure to light and heat can alter the fragrance composition.

Yes, you can experiment with layering different perfumes to create a unique scent combination. When layering fragrances, it's important to choose scents that complement each other well. Start by applying a base fragrance and then add a lighter fragrance on top to create depth and complexity.
